did.unittitle: Travelogues
Travelogues
Travelogues: Francis Yeats-Brown (India)
Caption: Major F. Yeats-Brown, Author of "The Lives of a Bengal Lancer" shown here in disguise as a German governess in Constantinople during the war (The Viking Press)
Caption: Major F. Yeats-Brown, Author of "The Lives of Bengal Lacer" shown here in his disguise as a German mechanic in Constantinople during the war (Viking Press)

Caption: Major F. Yeats-Brown, In full regalia as a cavalry officer in the Indian Bengal Lancers. His life in India is the subject of his newly published book, "The Lives of a Bengal Lancer" (Viking Press)

Caption: Major F. Yeats-Brown, Of the Indian Bengal Lancers standing between one of the senior officers of the Indian troops and one of the religious leaders of India. Major Yeats-Brown has just written the story of his life in "The Lives of a Bengal Lancer" (The Viking Press) [2 copies]

Caption: Major F. Yeats-Brown, (left center) with the polo team which won the Indian Cavalry and Inter-Regimental Tournaments in India in 1921. Polo I just one of the many adventures which he describes so vividly in his book "The Lives of a Bengal Lancer" (The Viking Press) [2 copies]

Travelogues: Royal Opera House, Covent Garden (London)

The famous Covent Garden Opera House in London, most celebrated theatre in the English speaking world. This was at the time when L.T. was telling the story of "With Lawrence in Arabia and With Allenby in Palestine," which was heard by more than a million people in London, and by some four million people around the world

Note: The famous Covent Garden Opera House in London, most celebrated theatre in the English speaking world. This was at the time when L.T. was telling the story of "With Lawrence in Arabia and With Allenby in Palestine," which was heard by more than a million people in London, and by some four million people around the world

The Bishop of Gloucester, the millionth visitor to see and hear With Allenby in Palestine and Lawrence in Arabia in London, congratulating Lowell Thomas outside the Royal Opera House, Covent Gardens, where Thomas told his strange tale of adventure for nearly a year

Verso: The Bishop of Gloucester, the millionth visitor to see and hear With Allenby in Palestine and Lawrence in Arabia in London, congratulating Lowell Thomas outside the Royal Opera House, Covent Gardens, where Thomas told his strange tale of adventure for nearly a year

Bishop 1,000,00th Visitor. The Bishop of Gloucester, Dr. Gibson, proved to be the 1,000,000th visitor to Mr. Lowell Thomas's moving picture travelogue. With Allenby in Palestine and Lawrence in Arabia" at the Queen's Hall, W., yesterday afternoon. The bishop expressed to Mr. Lowell Thomas, his great delight will the entertainment, which as stated in yesterday's Daily Mail, will close Friday. From the "Daily Mail" Jan 27th, Permission to use this photograph is given free of charge

Verso: Bishop 1,000,00th Visitor. The Bishop of Gloucester, Dr. Gibson, proved to be the 1,000,000th visitor to Mr. Lowell Thomas's moving picture travelogue. With Allenby in Palestine and Lawrence in Arabia" at the Queen's Hall, W., yesterday afternoon. The bishop expressed to Mr. Lowell Thomas, his great delight will the entertainment, which as stated in yesterday's Daily Mail, will close Friday. From the "Daily Mail" Jan 27th, Permission to use this photograph is given free of charge

In London, Lowell Thomas the American explorer and lecturer was heard by more than one million people who came to see him at the Royal Opera House. He is the most famous lecturer in the world today although still in his early thirties. Permission to use this photograph is given free of charge.

Verso: In London, Lowell Thomas the American explorer and lecturer was heard by more than one million people who came to see him at the Royal Opera House. He is the most famous lecturer in the world today although still in his early thirties. Permission to use this photograph is given free of charge.
